definition: to clear up/to wipe out/to eradicate
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Before no further clear, he also dare not to meet ZuoShaoQing.
sentences.chinese: 情況在沒有進一步廓清之前，他也不敢與左少卿見面。

sentences.english: So it is very necessary to define the concept of personal dangerousness.
sentences.chinese: 因此，正確廓清人身危險性的概念是刻不容緩的。

sentences.english: Ancient records on decorative gold are missing, and so it is difficult to sketch the outlines of its development.
sentences.chinese: 古代金飾記載缺佚，其發展狀況實難廓清。

sentences.english: The introduction put emphasis on clearing the tation of modernity.
sentences.chinese: 引言重在廓清“現代性”的概念。

sentences.english: I hope this helps clarify some of your questions.
sentences.chinese: 我盼望這能輔助廓清你們的一些答題。

sentences.english: But maybe it's possible to clear up some of the confusion.
sentences.chinese: 然而我們或許可以廓清一部分的紛亂。

sentences.english: This is a clouded issue at the core in the history of modern Chinese, which has never been cleaned up and under enough discussion.
sentences.chinese: 這是近代漢語史的核心問題，迄未廓清，又甚少討論。

sentences.english: The second section clarifies the basic framework of the system of conciliation of enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 二是廓清執行和解的基本框架。

sentences.english: This concept furtherly define the scope of study.
sentences.chinese: 這進一步廓清了本文研究的範圍。

sentences.english: Speak clear and demand silence to clear up the situation.
sentences.chinese: 講分明和需求的緘默來廓清這一狀況。

sentences.english: The clearance of short-lived radon daughters from rabbit lung is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文探討短壽命氡子體從家兔肺內的廓清。

sentences.english: To clear ground, the Nuremberg streetcar depot had to be removed.
sentences.chinese: 要想廓清場地，紐倫堡電車總站必須遷移。

definition: start and development/thread (of a story)/general outline/clue
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
lit. grass-cutter's comment (humble); fig. my observation as a humble layman/my humble opinion
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
to wash away/to eliminate/to do away with
to restore (deposed monarch, rule, system of laws, ecological system etc)/restoration
